Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Windmill \Wind"mill`\, n. A mill operated by the power of the wind, usually by the action of the wind upon oblique vanes or sails which radiate from a horizontal shaft. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
windmill n 1: a mill that is powered by the wind 2: generator that extracts usable energy from winds [syn: {aerogenerator}, {wind generator}]
